article:
An 'MTV Video Music Award' (commonly abbreviated as a 'VMA') is an award
presented by the cable channel MTV to honor the best in the music video medium.
Originally conceived as an alternative to the Grammy Awards (in the video
category), the annual MTV Video Music Awards ceremony has often been called the
"Oscars for youth", an acknowledgment of the VMA ceremony's ability to draw
millions of youth from teens to 20-somethings each year. By
2001, the VMA had become a coveted award. The statue given
to winners is an astronaut on the moon, one of the earliest representations of
MTV. The statue was conceived by Manhattan Designâalso designers of the original
MTV logoâbased on the 1981 "Top of the Hour" animation created by Fred Seibert,
produced by Alan Goodman, and produced by Buzz Potamkin at Buzzco Associates.

The annual VMA ceremony is usually held in mid-September, and broadcast live on
MTV. The first VMA ceremony was held in 1984 at New York City's Radio City Music
Hall. Other VMAs have been held in Los Angeles, Miami, Charlotte, and Las Vegas.
